docs.snippet: Ronaldo and Romario scored as Brazil beat the Czech Republic, 2-0, yesterday in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, for a berth in the FIFA Confederations Cup final on Sunday against Australia, which upset Uruguay,  1-0, in overtime.     Brazil (3-0-1) went ahead...
docs.lead_paragraph: Ronaldo and Romario scored as Brazil beat the Czech Republic, 2-0, yesterday in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, for a berth in the FIFA Confederations Cup final on Sunday against Australia, which upset Uruguay, 1-0, in overtime. Brazil (3-0-1) went ahead in the 54th minute when Romario -- the hero of the 1994 World Cup championship team -- scored off a pass from Juninho. Romario, FIFA's world player of the year in 1996, got his first goal of the tournament with seven minutes remaining.

headline.main: Brazil Will Face Australia in Final

docs.snippet: Clive Barker, coach of the South African national team, announced his resignation after a string of indifferent performances by the team. Barker made the announcement on his arrival at Johannesburg airport from Saudi Arabia yesterday.    Despite...
docs.lead_paragraph: Clive Barker, coach of the South African national team, announced his resignation after a string of indifferent performances by the team. Barker made the announcement on his arrival at Johannesburg airport from Saudi Arabia yesterday. Despite qualification for next summer's World Cup in France, South Africa failed to progress beyond its group matches in the Confederation Cup tournament in Riyadh, which involved the Czech Republic, the United Arab Emirates and Uruguay.
docs.abstract: Clive Barker resigns as coach of South African national soccer team; Iran drops plan to replace Valdeir Vierra as coach of its team (S)

docs.snippet: FOR the last eight years, Larry Brook Liddle has been studying what could be considered the crabgrass of the sea: pest-algae competing for space with natural, marine organisms.     Last year, Dr. Liddle, 61, took a sabbatical from Southampton College...
docs.lead_paragraph: FOR the last eight years, Larry Brook Liddle has been studying what could be considered the crabgrass of the sea: pest-algae competing for space with natural, marine organisms. Last year, Dr. Liddle, 61, took a sabbatical from Southampton College of Long Island University, where he has been teaching biology and marine science since 1976. Six months of his sabbatical was spent in France investigating Caulerpa taxifolia, an exotic feather-shaped tropical seaweed that has invaded the Mediterranean Sea.
docs.abstract: Dr Larry Brook Liddle, marine biologist at Southampton College, comments on his work on invasive algae called codium fragile, which is threatening to disrupt ecological balance in Long Island marine habitats; photo (L)

headline.main: Q&A: Dr. Larry Brook Liddle; Staying Hot on the Trail of Pest Algae

docs.snippet: Three goals apiece by Ronaldo and Romario led Brazil to a 6-0 victory over Australia yesterday in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, in the title game of the FIFA Confederations Cup.    The result was completely different from their previous meeting, which ended...
docs.lead_paragraph: Three goals apiece by Ronaldo and Romario led Brazil to a 6-0 victory over Australia yesterday in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, in the title game of the FIFA Confederations Cup. The result was completely different from their previous meeting, which ended in a scoreless tie. Brazil is the defending world champion; Australia failed to qualify for next summer's World Cup finals in France.
docs.abstract: Brazil defeats Australia, 6-0, in title game of FIFA Confederations Cup (S)

docs.snippet: Jerry Masucci, the owner of Fania Records and a seminal figure in the founding of New York salsa and its spread to other countries, died on Sunday in Buenos Aires, his main residence. He was 62.    The cause was an aneurysm that developed after...
docs.lead_paragraph: Jerry Masucci, the owner of Fania Records and a seminal figure in the founding of New York salsa and its spread to other countries, died on Sunday in Buenos Aires, his main residence. He was 62. The cause was an aneurysm that developed after surgery for abdominal pain, said a friend, the pianist and band leader Larry Harlow.
docs.abstract: Jerry Masucci, owner of Fania Records and promoter of salsa music, dies at age 62 (S)
